[RESOLVED by <@U6DN7UPJ7>’s fix] When I ran clang.jl's standard generator for wrapping julia around c library, it skipped function pointers as it is `CXType_FunctionProto`. For C

```typedef int (foo)(int, int);```
Is this right way to do it?
```
function f(Cint, Cint)::Cint end
foo = @cfunction(f, Cint, (Cint, Cint))```
But here f() returns nothing while expected to return Cint

text:
<@UKVBDU6HF> It's a nice package. But even if one header can't be parsed it doesn't define `cvts` which is necessary.
Thus not generating final functions for any at all. Maybe if that's allowed it would be great!

text: <@UN5FQHFNY> What doesn't parse?  The filter function already allows you to filter out any problematic items so that you can get a `cvts`.
